Name: Thayer, Mr. John Borland jr
Remarks: Inspiration for Jack Dawson in James Cameron's Titanic, L.D.Skitmore drew a sketch of the sinking according to his accounts

Name: Joughin, Mr. Charles John
Remarks: became known to have survived in the water for an exceptionally long time, admitted to hardly feeling the cold, most likely thanks to the alcohol he had imbibed. according to his and Isaac Maynards accounts he was most likely transfered to boat 12.

Name: Dorking, Mr. Edward Arthur
Remarks: According to his relatives, Dorking was sent to the US because he was openly gay

Name: O'Keefe, Mr. Patrick
Remarks: according to records he was transferred to 12

Name: Bride, Mr. Harold Sydney
Remarks: trapped under overturned lifeboat B but survived

Name: Lindsay, Mr. William Charles
Remarks: offered walter hurst a flask of brand which turned out to be peppermint essence

Name: Senior, Mr. Harry
Remarks: most likely got on the same boat as Lightoller as he keeps mentioning him and follows his orders.

Name: Whiteley, Mr. Thomas Arthur
Remarks: could have been on boat 12 with Joughin and Maynard, as he was the steward in the same working area as Joughin and was also near the same men the other two describe before the titanic hit the iceberg.

Name: Lightoller, Mr. Charles Herbert
Remarks: led the launch of most lifeboats

Name: Daniel, Mr. Robert Williams
Remarks: most likely rescued by B and transferred to boat 4

Name: Mason, Mr. Frank Archibald Robert
Remarks: super tough. his accounts suggest the exact three boats and his profession is on all boats. All boats still have space! some sources say 3 or 9. i say 4, as he was picked up by 4 from boat B, which is also in the records.

Name: Jonsson, Mr. Carl
Remarks: boarded boat B most likely and was then transferred to boat 4. his accounts mention lady Astor in the boat.
